item.description:
Here is an awesome place, on the coast of Portsmouth & Kittery, to picnic, have fun with the whole family, and learn some history at the same time...

http://www.portsmouth...

Out be the Coast Guard Station in Newcastle, have a picnic at Fort Constitution, FKA Fort William and Mary, utilized during the revolutionary war.
then actually, climb up to the top of the Portsmouth Harbor lighthouse, and for a small donation (suggested $4 per adult $2 per child), you can continue to help in the cause of the tremendous upkeep involved in this voluntary venture.
See the picture of the current restoration of the lighthouse, now going on.

the actual address of the Coast Guard Station is 25 Wentworth Road, Newcastle, NH for GPS users.

This is the first open house of the season, on May 30th, and I wish I could attend, but I have a former obligation. I believe the tall ships are coming into Portsmouth that day as well. What a great opportunity to see them, the lighthouse and fort, AND then go welcome out troops in with Steve at 5:30.

This will meetup will repeat, and you will more than likely see me there, at open houses through the summer, as a volunteer, when I can get away from Real Estate...lol.
Have a wonderful Memorial Day weekend and stay safe!!!

Susan

group.name: The Portsmouth "and beyond" Nite Out Meetup Group

item.name: Portsmouth Harbor Lighthouse tours 1-5 pm
